main event: A civilian reported seeing an unidentified object trailing smoke while descending through the clouds in Downey, California on August 23, 1952.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 3-4 minutes., The object was observed through breaks in the clouds., The witness initially thought it was a weather balloon, but it appeared too high and fast., The witness has extensive experience as a pilot since 1930., The overall tone of the report suggests a genuine observation without exaggeration.
witness description: A 45-year-old male civilian pilot with 27 years of residency in the area.
